articles.title: Second Meeting Report (Jan 10, 1955)
articles.summary: This document chronicles the formation and initial year of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club, from its first meetings in early 1955 to its formal incorporation by late 1955. It details the club's organizational efforts, including establishing bylaws, electing officers, and defining its purpose, alongside reports of regular meetings featuring astronomical talks, demonstrations, and community engagement. The club actively fostered amateur telescope making, observation, and general astronomical education among its growing membership.

articles.title: First Business Meeting Report (Jan 17, 1955)
articles.summary: This report details the first business meeting of a proposed club, held to revitalize interest and define its purpose after a low turnout at a previous event. Members discussed their expectations, planned for increased publicity for the next regular meeting, and considered distributing a questionnaire to gather consensus on future activities. The meeting concluded with members viewing an 8-inch reflector at 'Stole Observatory', though observations were hampered by cloudy weather.

articles.title: February Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: This document chronicles the early months of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club in 1955, detailing their formation, initial meetings, and formal incorporation. It highlights the club's growing membership, regular discussions on astronomical topics, telescope construction projects, and community engagement efforts like a booth at the Fiesta de San Jose. The records also include member feedback through questionnaires and plans for future activities and club development.

articles.title: Club Questionnaire
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club was formed in late 1954, holding its inaugural meetings and establishing temporary officers. Throughout 1955, the club formalized its structure, including incorporating, electing a board of directors, and drafting bylaws. Activities included monthly meetings with educational talks on constellations, telescope construction, and optical principles, alongside practical observation sessions and community outreach efforts like a booth at the Fiesta de San Jose.

articles.title: Third Meeting Report (Feb 21, 1955)
articles.summary: The document details the founding and early activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club throughout 1955. It covers regular meetings, planning sessions, and key organizational milestones such as formal incorporation, election of officers, and establishment of membership rules. The club engaged in educational talks on constellations, telescope construction, optics, and observational techniques, alongside community outreach efforts like a booth at the Fiesta de San Jose and planned star parties.

articles.title: Second Planning Meeting Report (March 9, 1955)
articles.summary: The second planning meeting, held on March 9, 1955, at Dean Pritchett's residence, involved nine attendees who discussed setting a program for the upcoming regular meeting and electing temporary officers: Walter Krumm (Chairman), Wesley Lindsay (Vice-Chairman), and Dean Pritchett (Secretary-Treasurer). The group decided the club would primarily focus on amateur telescope making, with secondary missions of discussion, study, and observation, and also explored the idea of a dedicated workshop night.

articles.title: March Meeting Announcement & News Clipping
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers meticulously documented their formative year from March to December 1955, detailing their organizational efforts including incorporation, election of a Board of Directors, and establishment of membership structures. Regular meetings consistently featured talks on constellations, telescope construction, optics, and general astronomy, complemented by practical observation sessions and discussions of club projects like building telescopes. The club also engaged in community outreach, participating in local events and growing its membership significantly.

articles.title: Fourth Meeting Report (March 21, 1955)
articles.summary: This document chronicles the foundational year of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) from March to December 1955, detailing their regular monthly and planning meetings. Key activities included formalizing the club's structure through incorporation and electing a board, organizing educational talks on constellations, optics, and telescope construction, and fostering community engagement through star parties, a public booth at the Fiesta de San Jose, and the initiation of a club telescope building project. The reports highlight the enthusiastic participation of members in various astronomical discussions, demonstrations, and observing sessions.

articles.title: April Planning Meeting Announcement (with map)
articles.summary: From March to December 1955, the Amateur Astronomy Club of San Jose evolved significantly, formally incorporating as the "San Jose Amateur Astronomers" and electing its first board and officers. The club actively held regular meetings featuring educational talks on constellations, optics, and telescope construction, along with practical demonstrations and observing sessions. Key initiatives included planning for club-built telescopes, participating in community outreach events like the Fiesta de San Jose, and discussing affiliations with larger astronomical organizations.

articles.title: Third Planning Meeting Report (April 6, 1955)
articles.summary: The third planning meeting of an astronomy club, held on April 6, 1955, at Walter Krumm's Cupertino residence with nine members, focused on future club organization, including drafting by-laws, and refining the 'Star Party' concept. Discussions also covered the upcoming April meeting program and a proposed rehearsal method for observational sessions. The gathering concluded with astronomical observations of Saturn, Jupiter, Mars, and the Moon, and a club stamp fund contribution was noted.

articles.title: April Meeting Announcement & News Clipping
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club underwent rapid formalization from April to December 1955, electing its first officers and Board of Directors, successfully incorporating, and establishing a structured membership with dues and benefits like Sky and Telescope subscriptions. During this period, the club hosted regular meetings featuring diverse educational talks on constellations, optics, telescope construction, and specific celestial objects, complemented by practical demonstrations and observing sessions. Notable activities included participating in a local fair, forming a committee to build club telescopes for member use, and continuously planning for future educational programs and star parties.

articles.title: Fifth Meeting Report (April 18, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club formally incorporated in 1955, establishing bylaws, electing a board of directors, and setting up membership dues. Throughout the year, the club held regular meetings featuring talks on constellations, telescope optics, construction, and celestial phenomena, alongside demonstrations and observing sessions. Key activities included participating in the Fiesta de San Jose, planning for a club telescope, and organizing future star parties and educational initiatives.

articles.title: May Planning Meeting Report (May 3, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) meticulously documented their activities from May to December 1955, detailing their formal incorporation, election of the first board and officers, and establishment of membership structures. Regular meetings featured educational talks on constellations, telescope mechanics, and celestial phenomena, while planning efforts initiated a club telescope construction project and organized community outreach events like the Fiesta de San Jose. This period reflects the foundational growth and active engagement of the newly formed amateur astronomy club.

articles.title: May Meeting Announcement & News Clipping
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers spent 1955 actively establishing its formal structure, incorporating the club, electing a Board of Directors, and finalizing bylaws and membership. Throughout the year, monthly meetings offered educational talks on constellations, telescope construction, and various astronomical subjects, complemented by observing sessions and community outreach events like the Fiesta de San Jose. The club also launched an ambitious project to build multiple portable telescopes for its members, marking a period of significant growth and activity.

articles.title: May Meeting Report (May 16, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers formally incorporated and elected its first Board of Directors and officers between May and July 1955. Throughout the latter half of the year, the club held regular monthly meetings featuring educational talks on constellations, telescope construction, optics, and celestial objects. They also engaged in community outreach through a booth at the Fiesta de San Jose and began planning for the construction of club telescopes, with an initial focus on a portable 6-inch reflector.

articles.title: Charter Membership Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) officially incorporated in May 1955, electing its initial Board of Directors and establishing membership guidelines. Throughout the latter half of the year, the club engaged in regular monthly meetings featuring technical talks on telescopes and optics, constellation studies, and observing sessions. Key activities included participating in local events, planning for a club telescope project, and connecting with other astronomical societies, showcasing a dynamic period of growth and organization for the newly formed club.

articles.title: Fiesta de San Jose Booth Report
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club participated in the Fiesta de San Jose hobby show from May 25-30, 1955, setting up a booth with donated telescopes and materials. Manned by various club members, the booth attracted general interest and provided valuable publicity and experience for the club. The article also includes details on club membership, dues, and contact information.

articles.title: Fiesta de San Jose Booth Handout
articles.summary: This handout from the Fiesta de San Jose in May 1955 introduces the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, an incorporated non-profit organization dedicated to encouraging amateur astronomical observation and research, particularly targeting individuals aged twelve to twenty. It details their monthly meetings at San Jose State College, membership options ($5 annual dues for voting, $4 for non-voting, both include 'Sky and Telescope' magazine), and provides contact information for further inquiries. Charter memberships were available until June 30, 1955.

articles.title: June Meeting Report (June 20, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) documented their activities from June to December 1955, encompassing regular monthly meetings, planning sessions, and significant club development. Key events included presentations on constellations, celestial objects, and technical aspects of telescope construction and observation, such as collimation and the Foucault test. The club also focused on organizational growth, including membership drives, the election of officers, formal incorporation, and the initiation of a club telescope building project, alongside participation in star parties and conventions.

articles.title: June Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club was highly active from June to December 1955, holding regular educational meetings, planning sessions, and formally incorporating. A significant focus was on the construction of club telescopes, starting with a 6-inch reflector, alongside talks on various astronomical topics, book reviews, and observation sessions. The club also elected new officers and actively engaged with the broader amateur astronomy community through star parties and discussions about joining the Astronomical League.

articles.title: June Planning Meeting Report (June 1, 1955)
articles.summary: The provided documents detail the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' planning and general meetings from June to December 1955. The club focused on educational programs, including constellation discussions, telescope technical talks (mountings, Foucault test, collimation), and planetary observation. Key developments include the club's incorporation, election of officers, plans for building two club telescopes, and participation in and organization of star parties.

articles.title: Club Member List & Policy Statement
articles.summary: The provided document details the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club from July to December 1955, including regular planning and general meetings. Key topics covered at these meetings ranged from constellation discussions and planetary observation to in-depth presentations on telescope construction, mountings, and optical testing. Notable events included the election of the club's first official officers, its formal incorporation, and the launch of an ambitious project to build two club telescopes for member use, with construction commencing by November.

articles.title: July Planning Meeting Report (July 7, 1955)
articles.summary: This document chronicles the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' meetings and activities from July to December 1955. It details planning meetings, election of officers, program topics covering constellations, planets, telescope construction, and various astronomical concepts, as well as the formation of a committee to build club telescopes. The club also focused on administrative tasks like formal incorporation and membership management.

articles.title: July Meeting Announcement & News Clipping
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club maintained a busy schedule from July to December 1955, featuring monthly general meetings and planning sessions with diverse astronomical programs. Significant organizational milestones included the finalization of the club's Articles of Incorporation and the formation of a committee to construct club telescopes, starting with a 6-inch reflector. Members regularly engaged in presentations on topics such as constellations, telescope design and testing, and celestial phenomena, often followed by observational sessions.

articles.title: Eighth Regular Monthly Meeting Report (July 18, 1955)
articles.summary: This document chronicles the monthly meetings and activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers (SJAA) from July to December 1955. It details various presentations on constellations, telescope construction (mountings, Foucault test, collimation), planets, and variable stars, alongside progress on forming a club telescope committee to build a 6-inch and a larger reflector. The reports also highlight administrative milestones like club incorporation, participation in star parties, and discussions about joining the Astronomical League, reflecting the club's growing membership and vibrant engagement in amateur astronomy.

articles.title: Seventh Planning Meeting Report (August 3, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held multiple planning and general meetings from August to December 1955, finalizing their Articles of Incorporation and significantly advancing plans for building club telescopes, starting with a 6-inch reflector. Meeting programs featured diverse topics including telescope mountings and construction, technical demonstrations like the Foucault Test and collimation, constellation studies, and discussions on celestial bodies and phenomena. The club also engaged in administrative matters, considered joining the Astronomical League, and participated in observing sessions.

articles.title: August Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club actively held planning and general meetings from August to December 1955, finalizing their incorporation and discussing various club initiatives. Key activities included planning star parties, proposing participation in the County Fair, and initiating a significant project to construct two club telescopes, beginning with a portable 6-inch reflector. Members delivered numerous presentations on astronomical topics such as constellations, celestial objects, telescope construction techniques, and book reviews, fostering a vibrant community spirit.

articles.title: Ninth Regular Meeting Report (August 15, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held their ninth regular meeting on August 15, 1955, where they formalized the club's incorporation and received presentations on topics like 'Amateur Telescope Making,' 'Cassiopeia,' and the 'Foucault Test,' which was followed by a practical demonstration. Discussions also covered plans for club participation in the Santa Clara County Fair and upcoming star parties, including one hosted by the Peninsula Astronomical Society.

articles.title: September Member & Non-Member Lists
articles.summary: This document details a meeting of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club, which included a talk by Dr. Geisler and a demonstration of the Foucault test, along with discussions about postponed talks and upcoming events like the Western Amateur Astronomers convention and the Peninsula Astronomical Society's Star Party. It also features comprehensive lists of club members and non-members, complete with addresses and some phone numbers, dated September 1, 1955.

articles.title: Eighth Planning Meeting Report (September 7, 1955)
articles.summary: The Eighth Planning Meeting of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers took place on September 7, 1955, at Bob Ferguson's home. Attendees viewed Saturn through a new 8-inch telescope and discussed club matters including a potential display for the Santa Clara County Fair in 1956, purchasing abrasives, and a suggestion for a library of neoprene forms for pitch laps. Plans were also made for an upcoming star party, contacting the Oakland Astronomy Club for convention proceedings, and arranging the next general meeting.

articles.title: September Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held a series of monthly general and planning meetings from September to December 1955, detailing club business, project planning, and educational programs. Discussions and presentations covered various astronomical topics such as constellations, planets, meteors, variable stars, telescope construction (including the decision to build two club telescopes), and technical aspects like collimation and glass expansion. The club also organized star parties, discussed administrative matters like incorporation and joining the Astronomical League, and celebrated its approximate one-year anniversary.

articles.title: September Meeting Minutes (September 19, 1955)
articles.summary: The September monthly meeting of an astronomy club featured talks on recent convention papers, the constellations Pegasus and Andromeda, and telescope tripod mountings. Attendees also received a copy of the 1954 Western Amateur Astronomers convention proceedings and an invitation to an upcoming star party. The evening concluded with an observing session at Columbus Park.

articles.title: October Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: This document contains the minutes for both September and October planning meetings of an astronomy club. The September meeting featured talks on a recent astronomy convention, constellations, and telescope mounts, concluding with an invitation to a star party and post-meeting observing. The October planning meeting addressed club incorporation, procurement of materials for telescope making, a prize-winning letter, a plan for announcements, and the formation of a committee to build a club telescope, alongside discussions about joining the Astronomical League.

articles.title: October Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club held a series of meetings from October to December 1955, focusing on administrative matters, educational programs, and a significant club telescope construction project. Discussions covered topics like joining the Astronomical League, purchasing materials, and presenting various astronomical subjects. A committee was formed to plan and initiate the building of two club telescopes, starting with a portable 6-inch reflector, with members volunteering their time and skills.

articles.title: October General Meeting Minutes (October 17, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held general and planning meetings from October through December 1955, covering a range of astronomical topics and club business. Key discussions included considering joining the Astronomical League, outlining programs with member presentations on constellations, planets, and technical subjects, and initiating the ambitious project of building two club telescopes. The club also organized social gatherings, welcomed new members, and planned future events and talks, including a series on individual planets.

articles.title: November Planning Meeting Report (November 2, 1955)
articles.summary: This document compiles the minutes from the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' October 1955 general meeting and the report from their November 2, 1955 planning meeting. The October meeting featured talks on Perseus, glass expansion, and telescope collimation, followed by a Q&A. The November planning meeting organized the program for the next general meeting, including topics like Taurus, a map of the universe, and an orrery, and also scheduled a meeting for the club telescope committee.

articles.title: Club Telescope Committee Report
articles.summary: The newly formed Club Telescope Committee held its inaugural meeting on November 7th, 1955, electing Mr. Delaney as chairman and Mr. Nelson as secretary. The committee decided, pending membership approval, to construct two telescopes: a highly portable 6-inch f/8 reflector for member loans, to be completed first and built with minimal cost, followed by a higher quality, member-built 10 or 12-inch richest field telescope.

articles.title: November Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: The provided documents detail the November and December 1955 meetings of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers. Key activities included various astronomy presentations, book reviews, and significant progress on a club telescope project, with initial plans for a portable 6-inch reflector and a subsequent larger richest field telescope. The club also celebrated its approximate one-year anniversary and announced future events and projects.

articles.title: November Meeting Minutes (November 21, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held their November 21, 1955 meeting, featuring presentations on Taurus, the "Map of the Universe," astronomical books, and an Orrery. A primary focus was the club telescope project, with a committee reporting on plans for a portable 6-inch reflector and a larger 10-12 inch richest field telescope; a motion to purchase a 6-inch mirror kit was passed. Other announcements included upcoming star map sales and welcoming a new member.

articles.title: November Constellation Chart (Taurus)
articles.summary: This document describes a historical meeting of astronomers held on Monday, November 21, 1955, at 8:00 PM in the Science Wing of San Jose State College. Mr. Krumm called the meeting to order, and Malcolm Gilmour was scheduled to present the first part of the program.

articles.title: December Planning Meeting Report (December 7, 1955)
articles.summary: This document reports on the December 7, 1955 planning meeting of an amateur astronomy club, outlining various club activities and discussions. Key topics included presentations on astronomical maps and models, book reviews, updates on the club telescope, and the purchase of a 6" mirror kit. The meeting also planned the program for the upcoming December club meeting, featuring talks on Auriga, Mercury, the Christmas Star, and variable stars, and welcomed a new member.

articles.title: December Meeting Announcement
articles.summary: This document details the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' December 1955 planning and general meetings. Topics discussed included Auriga, Mercury, the Christmas Star, and variable stars, while the club also celebrated its first anniversary. Announcements were made regarding star map sales, future speakers, and a new member.

articles.title: December Meeting Minutes (December 19, 1955)
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held their December 1955 planning and general meetings, outlining and then executing a program of talks. The general meeting, held on December 19th, featured discussions on the constellation Auriga, the planet Mercury, the Christmas Star, and an introduction to variable stars, while also marking the club's unofficial one-year anniversary. Key announcements included future meeting details and an upcoming price increase for star charts.
